TopicTitle: [Solved] If you .craft files don't save in your KSP folder

Articles.Content:
If you're crafts/screenshots/quicksaves files don't save to your ksp saves folder it's because it got saved to your user/appdata folder. Not wherever you placed the unziped KSP

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-02T04:19:47Z" title="06/02/2015 04:19  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 2, 2015</time> by clown\_baby**

Stock ships are stored in the "ships" folder next to the KSP executable, which I suspect is where you're looking, but the ships you save in game are stored in:

saves/[your save name]/ships/VAB or SPH

Where "saves" is also in the same folder as KSP.exe

As for screenshots:

If you are using the KSP screenshot function (F1 by default) they will be stored in "screenshots" next to the KSP executable.

If you are using the Steam screenshot function (F12 I think?) they'll be stored somewhere else. (I don't use Steam so I don't know where)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-01T20:34:14Z" title="06/01/2015 08:34  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 1, 2015</time> by TheMoonRover**

> 
> Stock ships are stored in the "ships" folder next to the KSP executable, which I suspect is where you're looking, but the ships you save in game are stored in:
> saves/[your save name]/ships/VAB or SPH
> 
> Where "saves" is also in the same folder as KSP.exe
> 
> As for screenshots:
> 
> If you are using the KSP screenshot function (F1 by default) they will be stored in "screenshots" next to the KSP executable.
> 
> If you are using the Steam screenshot function (F12 I think?) they'll be stored somewhere else. (I don't use Steam so I don't know where)

Sorry I should have been more specific. I'm looking in my default saved folder, I'm very familiar with the save locations within the KSP folder. This is some weird problem that the ships are still there I just can't see the .craft files.

Where is KSP installed?

If it's on the desktop you may have to look in your user folder as Windows will prevent KSP from writing to the desktop.

Usually your craft are in the saves folder, and your screenshots are in screenshots, both within the KSP game folder.

Try searching for one of your craft file names.

Ah, okay. Yeah, what Sal said. Try the AppData folder first (it may have a different name depending on your windows version but it's AppData on Windows 8 and probably 7). It'll probably be in the same place as your (My) Documents, (My) Pictures, etc. folders, although it may be hidden. If it's hidden, try entering the location manually in the address bar, or go to properties and unhide everything in your user folder (Caution: bad things might happen if you start messing with any of the other hidden files though (although it's unlikely))

Sal\_vager. My KSP stores things in the correct place. It's under C:\...\Desktop\Games\KSP\ksp-win-1-0-2\KSP\_win

Does it work because it's in a folder in a folder (...) in the desktop, or is it some other reason?

The ksp folder is stored in programs 86. Used the search function to scan the whole folder and I still can't find them. All crafts load in game though.

[edit]solved it

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-02T04:19:01Z" title="06/02/2015 04:19  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 2, 2015</time> by clown\_baby**

TheMoonRover, depends on your settings, it's data execution prevention that prevents KSP from writing files, if you're admin it may be why.

This needs to be a lot more visible, it's in the support sticky:

> 
> In case you installed KSP into a Windows protected directory (C:\Users, C:\Program Files or C:\Windows\ and their subfolders) the output log file may be stored in the folder called C:\Users\[username]\Appdata, this folder is usually hidden so you should enable the view hidden folders option

Glad you figured it out clown\_baby, thanks for helping clarify it TheMoonRover ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> TheMoonRover, depends on your settings, it's data execution prevention that prevents KSP from writing files, if you're admin it may be why.
> This needs to be a lot more visible, it's in the support sticky:
> 
> Glad you figured it out clown\_baby, thanks for helping clarify it TheMoonRover ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Interesting. Where is a good place in windows to put it then/how do I allow windows to write in the file. Because it's super annoying as is. Also would this be the reason none of my mods work?

Best place is any folder that Windows did not make when it was installed, so I recommend C:\Games, as you make this ourself.

Files flagged by data execution prevention will still be prevented from modifying the system though, so they need to be copied, the copies are treated as new files.

Steam avoids this issue by writing to the registry, telling Windows that the program has permission to write to its own folder.
